page.title: 02The Church of All Saints
page.content: All Saints' Church, Little Shelford, was built in 1080.The de Freville family played a great part in founding certain parts of this church.Sir John de Freville built the chancel and founded the tower,while his son's wife founded the chantry.The Nave and tower were rebuilt in 1450,and in 1633 the pulpit and canopy were installed.The ancient stained glass windows in Chantry of the church were still intact in 1802.Repairs were made on the church in the year of 1854,and the Sanctuary was rebuilt in 1878.There are six bells,and the present Rector's name is Stephen.G.Taylor.The church is not locked,and people are free to go in and either pray or read the interesting leaflets.Inside the church there are also many plaques in memory of old villagers,and rectors.
